definition: to rush about/to be constantly on the move
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
wave/ripple/storm/surge

sentences.english: The manager has been batting around all morning, giving instructions to every department.
sentences.chinese: 經理奔波了一個上午，給各部門下達指示。

sentences.english: It can be that I am destined to struggle endlessly in the sea of art.
sentences.chinese: 爲藝術，我將情願不停地在藝海中奔波。

sentences.english: You toil to fill the mouths of your, but food is scarce.
sentences.chinese: 你各處奔波以填飽你孩子的嘴，但食物卻很少。

sentences.english: For me, I'm still a student and sonner or later running about my job.
sentences.chinese: 至於我，還是學生，也是遲早會爲了工作奔波。

sentences.english: You everywhere rush about, difficult seeking, discontentedly in present situation.
sentences.chinese: 你到處奔波，艱苦求索，不滿於現狀。

sentences.english: Whether you in for to everywhere search various aspects the soft attire monomer source material to rush about?
sentences.chinese: 您是否在爲爲到處搜索各方面的軟裝單體素材而奔波？

sentences.english: He had been proscribed, a wanderer, poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾被放逐，四處奔波，窮苦。

sentences.english: You finally stop moving every single day, stop traveling between rented flats.
sentences.chinese: 你終於不用四處奔波，搬來搬去的住租來的房子。

sentences.english: One night I had a nightmare, running whole night for unobtainable thing. I made a decision when I was awoken.
sentences.chinese: 前夜作了一個奔波生計的夢，醒來後暗暗地決定。

sentences.english: Wang run early in the city, she did four households part-time one day.
sentences.chinese: 王小早奔波在城市裏，她一天做四戶人家的鐘點工。

sentences.english: Nowadays, many people keep on the move, expecting there to be better-paid jobs.
sentences.chinese: 現在很多人都在奔波着，希望能找到一份更好的工作。

sentences.english: She's been traipsing back and forth across the world.
sentences.chinese: 她一直奔波於世界各地。

sentences.english: They meander back and forth in a series of curves.
sentences.chinese: 他們河曲回奔波在一系列的曲線。

sentences.english: He runs between his home and his company.
sentences.chinese: 他奔波於家與公司之間。

sentences.english: Being overly preemptive makes us live in an imaginary future vs. in the present.
sentences.chinese: 過度先發制人使我們奔波於想象的未來和現實的當下。

sentences.english: She activity-they money to deliver rbis.
sentences.chinese: 她四處奔波，花錢打點從中搭救。

definition: to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to rush about on errands/to be kept on the run
to run/to rush about/to be on the go
busy/bustling
to work hard/to look after
tired/exhausted/worn out/to toil
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to work hard/to toil
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
laborious
exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
(literary) fatigued/wearied
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
